title: Are there any companies that make civilian drones that are completely silent when they're in use? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Are there any companies that make civilian drones that are completely silent when they're in use?” Sure, look for balloon drones. They’re totally silent when floating, and make only minimal noise when gliding. They do have a small propeller, which makes some noise, but since it does not need to lift the drone, the power level and the noise are orders of magnitude lower than that of quadcopters. Practically inaudible from a distance of 3m or so, and they look cute.

Kind’a. Look for gliders that can use Ardupilot firmware for its flight controller. It has an autonomous soaring mode. If conditions are right, the software will seek and use thermals on its own. That means sustained flight with the engine off. Mostly you’ll have to DIY. It’s not that making and flying acoustically quiet UAV is a secret. It’s just that there’s not much of a demand.
